[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 109]
Reasoning: **Evaluating card possibilities**

I’m currently selecting a hand in the small blind, and I need 11,000. From the remaining cards—J♥, 2♥, K♣, 9♣, 7♣, 6♣, J♦, and 10♦—I’ve got four hands and three discards left. I see I can make a flush with four clubs (K, 9, 7, 6) but not a straight. For a straight flush, I’d need cards in the same suit in sequence, but I can only try for potential straights or flushes with the remaining discards.
**Calculating potential wins**

I’m thinking about the 11,000 threshold I need to reach. Maybe I could achieve it in two hands by getting a straight flush worth 7,000 plus another scoring hand. However, I currently don’t have a straight flush. I’ll use my discards to search for suited connectors. Since I have four clubs, I could aim for a flush hand for some chips, but I still likely need straight flushes to get over the threshold, ideally two of them. Plus, using all discards can help boost my multiplier.
**Analyzing straight flush potential**

I need four specific cards to form a straight flush, and only those cards will count. I'm thinking a four-card straight flush would sum to 180 chips if I can get the right high cards, with a mult base of 12. The Mystic Summit can boost my multiplier by 15, but only if I have zero discards. However, even with these calculations, the total would only be 9,720, which doesn’t meet the 11,000 requirement. It seems like even a strong straight flush may not cut it in one hand.
**Considering scoring strategies**

I’m realizing that I might need at least two hands to reach a better chip total. If I aim for a five-card straight flush, including higher cards like an Ace might help boost my chips. However, even with a strong five-card straight flush, my calculations show I’d only reach 10,206 chips, which still isn’t enough. It seems better to use my discards wisely before scoring big, potentially triggering Mystic Summit’s boost. I could start with a flush using my four clubs and save the discards for later if needed.
**Planning optimal discards**

I need to be careful not to waste any potential for a straight flush. With four hands, I can use my discards strategically to improve my hand composition, focusing on the clubs I've got. Currently, I can play a flush that might yield 67 chips, but that's quite low.

I'll prioritize discarding my non-clubs—specifically J♥, 2♥, J♦, and 10♦—and keep my clubs. This will maximize my chance of drawing key cards like 8♣ and 10♣ for a straight flush. After discarding, I'll assess my new hand and decide on further actions accordingly.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
